Material: GOLD; LAPIS LAZULI; CARNELIAN; AMETHYST; TURQUOISE
Name: Beautiful Pectoral of Mereret
Description: This necklace with a pectoral had once adorned the figure of Queen Mereret, the daughter of King Senusert the Third and sister of his successor Amenemhat the Third. It is made out of gold, turquoise, lapis lazuli, and other materials. It bears a cartouche containing the coronation name of Amenemhat the Third as decoration. Represented as two falcon-headed sphinxes, the king smites his enemies. Above, the vulture-goddess, Nekhbet, is shown spreading out her wings to protect the figure of the king and his name.
